title: Disabling OCSP via MDM
content:
Hello ,

My organization apply SSL inspection policy on the corporate endpoints.

While chrome is acting as normal, Firefox throws an "SEC_ERROR_OCSP_INVALID_SIGNING_CERT" Error. Now i know the ocsp should be turned off but i didnt find a way or a plist setting to disable that.

Please help :)
creator: aviran1

title: Problem logging work for JIRA with Mozilla Firefox
content:
Hello,

I use TMetric to measure time on issues in the JIRA system. I have TMetric integration for JIRA Software enabled - you can see it in the picture 1.png

I use the Mozilla Firefox (95.0) web browser. Always the current version. The problem is that TMetric correctly calculates the measured time 1:04 as the sum of the measured times for the given issue, but the time is not logged in the JIRA system (Work log). Watch the picture 2.png and 3.png. This is a problem for me because it is not possible to get the measured time into JIRA reports and the reported capacities do not fit.

I did not have a problem with this before, and when measuring time, the time was reported as Log Work to the JIRA system after the end of the measurement. There was no problem with back-editing the time, which also manifested itself in the log work. It doesn't work at all right now. I tried it in another browser (Microsoft Edge) and I realized that it works.

Please tell me if the problem is with you and can be fixed, or if I should contact TMetric Support and what I can tell them to inform them that it is wrong. Or if you don't have a tip on how to fix it? I don't know what the problem might be.

Thank you. Regards Pavel Franc
creator: pf93

title: Captive Network login, redo: Detectportal?
content:
I must log in to the WiFi network I use. When I start FireFox the first time, it brings up my login page, I click [Accept], and I'm online. After a while on, I get kicked off, and must log in again. (The non-internet, WiFi connection remains active; but I'm neither logged in nor online.) How do I re-initialize the automatic login function ("detectportal"?)?

Closing, and re-starting FireFox again doesn't work; it initially tries to go to my homepage instead... *but it can't*, because I'm not online. I can't go to the login page's displayed URL, for the same reason. I have to actually restart the computer, loosing whatever I'm doing, then start FireFox. Then, and only then, can I get it to go to the network login page so I can login and continue.

Is there a button, "about:thingie", or setting I can use to reinitialize the automatic login page search & display mechanism? Rebooting the whole computer is a xxxx.
creator: ReggieA

title: fixed
content: здравствуйте. обновление браузера до версии 95.0 с трудом запускается сайт пайпал и бендкемп. пофиксите пожалуйста это очень важно.
creator: forestbuddhatechno

title: Default language in Gmail.
content: I use Firefox as my main browser but, in Gmail it always defaults to English US although I change it to English UK. I use this because of spell check in Australian English I have checked Gmail settings and Google settings. All are English UK. If I use Chrome, I always get English UK when I open Gmail.com. Why can't I change to UK in Gmail when using Firefox?

title: I can't download anything on Firefox even after disabling all of my extentions. Troubleshoot mode works, but I don't know why.
content:
As I described in my subject, I can't download ANYTHING through Firefox, unless it's in troubleshoot mode. I know that troubleshoot mode disables multiple things, including all of your themes and extensions and add-ons. For example, I can't open my own files in my AOL or Gmail email and download them. I also can't download things from my Google Drive. (Unless I'm in troubleshoot mode.)

However, thinking that it must be one of my add-ons, such as my adblock or any other one (and I mostly just have an adblock), I opened Firefox normally and completely disabled all of my add-ons, but that did not fix the problem.

I also tried downloading things while I had my Antivirus briefly paused, but that didn't work either.

The only time I can download things is in troubleshoot mode, and I don't know what's causing the problem.
creator: jxinf
